title: Accounts Payable
subtitle: Money a business owes to suppliers
content: Accounts Payable (AP) represent short-term obligations a company owes to vendors for goods or services purchased on credit.

title: Accounts Receivable
subtitle: Money owed by customers
content: Accounts Receivable (AR) are amounts due from customers for goods or services delivered on credit.

title: Accrual Accounting
subtitle: Record revenue/expenses when earned/incurred
content: Accrual accounting recognizes income when earned and expenses when incurred, regardless of cash movement.

title: Balance Sheet
subtitle: Assets = Liabilities + Equity
content: The balance sheet shows a company’s financial position at a point in time using the accounting equation.

title: Cash Flow Statement
subtitle: Operating, investing, and financing cash
content: Reports cash movements across operations, investing activities, and financing activities over a period.

title: COGS
subtitle: Cost of goods sold
content: Direct costs attributable to producing goods sold by a company (materials, direct labor).

title: EBITDA
subtitle: Operating performance proxy
content: Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization; a measure of core operating profitability.

title: Working Capital
subtitle: Current assets minus current liabilities
content: Indicates short-term liquidity and ability to meet near-term obligations.

title: Accredited Investor
subtitle: Eligibility standard for private investments
content: Meets income or net-worth thresholds to invest in certain private offerings.

title: Alpha
subtitle: Excess return over a benchmark
content: Measures performance relative to risk-adjusted expectations of a benchmark index.

title: Beta
subtitle: Market risk sensitivity
content: Indicates how much a security moves with the overall market; >1 is more volatile than the market.

title: Diversification
subtitle: Spread risk across assets
content: Holding uncorrelated assets reduces exposure to any single source of risk.

title: ETF
subtitle: Exchange-traded fund
content: A pooled investment that tracks an index or theme and trades like a stock.

title: Index Fund
subtitle: Passive fund tracking an index
content: Seeks to replicate the performance of a market index with low turnover and fees.

title: P/E Ratio
subtitle: Price-to-earnings multiple
content: Stock price divided by earnings per share; used to gauge valuation vs. earnings.

title: Yield Curve
subtitle: Bond yields by maturity
content: Plots interest rates of similar-quality bonds across maturities; shape can signal economic outlook.

title: 1099 Form
subtitle: Reports non-wage income
content: Form 1099 reports income such as freelance earnings, interest, or dividends.

title: AMT
subtitle: Alternative Minimum Tax
content: Parallel tax system ensuring certain taxpayers pay at least a minimum amount of tax.

title: Basis
subtitle: Tax basis in property
content: Generally cost plus improvements minus depreciation; determines gain or loss on sale.

title: Capital Gains Tax
subtitle: Tax on profit from asset sales
content: Applies to profit realized on the sale of capital assets; rates vary by holding period.

title: Depreciation Recapture
subtitle: Tax on prior deductions at sale
content: Portion of gain attributable to depreciation deductions may be taxed at ordinary or special rates.

title: Marginal Tax Rate
subtitle: Tax rate on last dollar earned
content: The rate applied to your top bracket—not your average tax rate.

title: QBI Deduction
subtitle: Section 199A up to 20% deduction
content: Deduction for qualified business income from pass-through entities, subject to limits.

title: Schedule K-1
subtitle: Reports owner’s share of pass-through income
content: Issued to partners and S-corp shareholders; details income, deductions, and credits.

title: 401(k) Plan
subtitle: Employer-sponsored retirement plan
content: Allows pre-tax or Roth contributions; often includes employer matching.

title: 403(b) Plan
subtitle: Retirement plan for nonprofits/education
content: Similar to a 401(k) but for certain public schools and tax-exempt organizations.

title: Catch-Up Contributions
subtitle: Extra contributions age 50+
content: Older workers can contribute above standard limits to 401(k)s and IRAs.

title: Defined Benefit Plan
subtitle: Traditional pension
content: Promises a specified benefit at retirement, often based on salary and years of service.

title: Defined Contribution Plan
subtitle: Employee-directed accounts
content: Specifies contributions, not payout; retirement value depends on investment performance.

title: HSA
subtitle: Health Savings Account
content: Triple tax-advantaged account for medical expenses (deductible contributions, tax-free growth and withdrawals for qualified expenses).

title: Roth IRA
subtitle: After-tax IRA with tax-free withdrawals
content: Contributions are post-tax; qualified withdrawals are tax-free.

title: Vesting Schedule
subtitle: When contributions/equity become yours
content: Defines ownership timing for employer contributions or equity grants (e.g., cliff and graded).

title: Angel Investor
subtitle: Wealthy individual investing early
content: Provides seed capital, often with mentorship, in exchange for equity or convertible notes.

title: Burn Rate
subtitle: Monthly net cash outflow
content: How quickly a startup uses cash; runway = cash balance ÷ burn rate.

title: Cap Table
subtitle: Record of ownership and dilution
content: Tracks founders, investors, option pools, and security types with fully diluted percentages.

title: Convertible Note
subtitle: Debt that converts into equity
content: Typically converts in a future round, often with a discount and/or valuation cap.

title: Down Round
subtitle: New valuation below prior round
content: Financing at a lower valuation than before; often triggers anti-dilution provisions.

title: SAFE
subtitle: Simple Agreement for Future Equity
content: A contract granting future equity on trigger events, usually with a valuation cap/discount.

title: Term Sheet
subtitle: Non-binding summary of deal terms
content: Outlines valuation, security type, investor rights, and closing conditions.

title: Unicorn
subtitle: Private company valued ≥ $1B
content: Shorthand for highly valued venture-backed startups.
